de.esoco.lib.collection

Class AbstractObservableCollection<T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>,E extends CollectionEvent<T,C>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<T>
      • de.esoco.lib.collection.AbstractObservableCollection<T,C,E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.event.EventSource<E>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ObservableCollection, ObservableList, ObservableSet

    public abstract class AbstractObservableCollection<T,C extends java.util.Collection<T>,E extends CollectionEvent<T,C>>
extends java.util.AbstractCollection<T>
implements de.esoco.lib.event.EventSource<E>, java.io.Serializable
    A base class for collection implementations that can be observed for changes. This is done by wrapping an arbitrary collection and sending events about pending changes to the wrapped collection to registered listeners. Listeners must implement the EventHandler interface and can be registered through the method addListener(EventHandler). This class supports all element event types as defined in the ElementEvent class.

    The generic parameters allow subclasses to define the element type (T), the type of the wrapped collection (C), and the type of collection event thrown by the implementation (E).

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createEvent

        protected abstract E createEvent(de.esoco.lib.event.ElementEvent.EventType rType,
                                 T rElement,
                                 T rUpdateValue,
                                 int nIndex)
        Must be implemented by subclasses to create a new event object. This method will only be invoked if listeners have been registered on this observable collection instance, so implementations need not test this. See the method notifyListeners(ElementEvent.EventType, Object, Object, int) for more details.
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of event
        rElement - The element affected by the event
        rUpdateValue - The new element value in case of an update event
        nIndex - The position index for random access collections
        Returns:
        A new event object

      • getObservedCollection

        protected final C getObservedCollection()
        Method for subclasses to access the observed collection.
        Returns:
        The observed collection

      • notifyListeners

        protected void notifyListeners(de.esoco.lib.event.ElementEvent.EventType rType,
                               T rElement,
                               T rUpdateValue,
                               int nIndex)
        Notifies all registered listeners of a collection event. The method createEvent(ElementEvent.EventType, Object, Object, int) will be invoked to create the event object.

        The last parameter is an index value for random access collections like lists. It has been included to ease the implementation of different subclasses, other collection implementations should ignore it. The methods in this class (like add(Object) invoke this method with an index value of -1. Subclasses should either interpret this accordingly (e.g. as the last element) or override these methods to determine the appropriate index by themselves.

        Parameters:
        rType - The type of event
        rElement - The element affected by the event
        rUpdateValue - The new element value in case of an update event
        nIndex - The position index for random access collections
